usefulItems: 2 round cake tins (Ø 20 cm), baking paper, skewer, serving plate or cake stand, oven
title: Chocolate Jaffa Cake (gluten free)

ingredients.content: 100 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
45 g gluten free dark chocolate (e.g. Kinnerton), in small pieces
2 bananas, ripe (approx. 200 g), cut in pieces
180 g gluten free plain white flour
200 g gluten free dark chocolate (e.g. Kinnerton), in small pieces

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease sides and line bases of 2 cake tins (Ø 20 cm) with baking paper.
Place chocolate and orange peel in mixing bowl then grate <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place dates in mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Add to reserved chocolate and orange peel then set aside.
Place bananas and eggs in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add oil, milk, flour, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and reserved chocolate mixture then mix <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>.
Divide evenly between prepared tins. Bake for 25-30 minutes (170°C) or until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Leave to cool in tins before removing. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.
Once cakes are cool, make ganache.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add margarine and melt <b>5 min/50°C/speed 0.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then melt again <b>2 min/50°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Add icing sugar and soya milk then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.
Place one sponge on a serving plate and spread a thin layer of ganache over then place other sponge on top. Spread remaining ganache over top of cake. Cut in slices to serve.

hintsAndTricks: Use a brand of chocolate that is gluten, egg, dairy and nut free, such as Kinnerton.
For a truly allergy free cake, always check that all your ingredients come from a source free of allergens.
